newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Yeltsin satisfied with Svyazinvest tender - Chubais.
newsitem.headline: Yeltsin satisfied with Svyazinvest tender - Chubais.

text.p: President Boris Yeltsin is satisfied with a controversial telecommunications privatisation which has sparked off a major public row in Russia, Interfax news agency quoted a top aide as saying on Wednesday.

"B. Yeltsin is satisfied that the tender went according to the tough rules which had been laid down and followed," First Deputy Prime Minister Anatoly Chubais said after briefing Yeltsin on a tender to sell off 25 percent of the Svyazinvest telecommunications giant.

The row flared up last week when it was announced that the 25 percent plus one share stake in Svyazinvest -- Russia's biggest privatisation -- was won by a consortium built around Uneximbank, Russia's third biggest bank.

The bid was backed by several foreign entities, including Deutsche Morgan Grenfell (DMG), the London-based investment banking division of Germany's Deutsche Bank, billionaire financier George Soros and U.S. asset management group Morgan Stanley Asset Management.
Participants in the losing consortium have not been officially identified, but the Russian media have named business tycoons Vladimir Gusinsky and Boris Berezovsky.

Powerful media organisations controlled by the two men's business groups, have launched a bitter attack on reformist ministers over the deal, saying it was a shadowy affair between state officials and financial magnates.
